sentences.text: March 23, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please accept our invitation to attend our Annual Meeting of Shareholders on Wednesday, May 3, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This years meeting will be held at AMP by Strathmore located at the Trusts Pike & Rose property, 11810 Grand Park Avenue, North Bethesda, Maryland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The business to be conducted at the meeting is described in the formal notice that follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, management will provide a review of 2016 operating results and discuss the outlook for the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the formal presentation, our Trustees and management will be available to answer any questions you may have.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please take this time to vote via the Internet (www.voteproxy.com) or by telephone (1-800-PROXIES or 1-800-776-9437).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to seeing you on May 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joseph S. Vassalluzzo Non-Executive Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Donald C. Wood President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS TO BE HELD MAY 3, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To Our Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Federal Realty Investment Trust will be held at AMP by Strathmore located at 11810 Grand Park Avenue, North Bethesda, Maryland, on Wednesday, May 3, 2017, at 10:00 a.m. for the purpose of considering and acting upon the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of seven Trustees to serve until our 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. The ratification of the appointment of Grant Thornton LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. An advisory vote approving the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. An advisory vote on the frequency of holding future votes on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. The transaction of such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any adjournment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record at the close of business on March 14, 2017 are entitled to notice of and to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the Trustees:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dawn M. Becker Executive Vice PresidentGeneral Counsel and Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the meeting, please vote via the Internet (www.voteproxy.com) or by telephone (1-800-PROXIES or 1-800-776-9437) by following the instructions on the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or as instructed in the accompanying proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received or requested a copy of the proxy card by mail or by e-mail, you may submit your vote by mail; however, we encourage you to vote via the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These methods are convenient and save us significant postage and processing charges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the meeting, you may revoke your proxy and vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing these proxy materials in connection with the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (Annual Meeting) of Federal Realty Investment Trust (the Trust).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These materials will assist you in voting your common shares of beneficial interest of the Trust (Shares) by providing information on matters that will be presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ELECTRONIC AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are furnishing proxy materials including this proxy statement and our 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders, which includes our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 (Annual Report), to each shareholder by providing access to such documents on the Internet instead of mailing printed copies unless you previously requested to receive these materials by mail or e-mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 23, 2017, we mailed to our shareholders who have not previously requested to receive these materials by mail or e-mail a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) containing instructions on how to access and review this proxy statement and our Annual Report and how to submit your vote on the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You cannot vote by marking the Notice and returning it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received the Notice by mail, you will not automatically receive a printed copy of our proxy materials or Annual Report unless you follow the instructions for requesting these materials included in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are receiving these materials because you owned our Shares as of March 14, 2017, the record date established by our Board of Trustees (Board) for our Annual Meeting of Shareholders (Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Everyone who owned our Shares as of that date, whether directly as a registered shareholder or indirectly through a broker or other nominee, is entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We had 72,172,665 Shares outstanding on March 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the Shares entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting must be present in person or by proxy for us to proceed with the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a shareholder, you are entitled to cast one vote per Share; however, as to the election of Trustees, you are entitled to cast one vote per Share for each of the seven open trustee positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your Shares in different ways (i.e., joint tenancy, trusts, custodial accounts) or in multiple accounts, you will receive more than one Notice, proxy card, voting instruction form or email, or any combination of these.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should provide voting instructions for all Notices, proxy cards, voting instruction forms and email links you receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered shareholder owning your Shares directly, you can vote either in person at the Annual Meeting or by proxy without attending the Annual Meeting through one of the following methods:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By telephone by dialing 1-800-PROXIES (1-800-776-9437)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the internet at www.voteproxy.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By completing and signing the accompanying proxy card if you elect to receive shareholder materials by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When you return a proxy card that is properly signed and completed, the Shares represented by your proxy will be voted as you specify on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign and return your proxy card without indicating how you want your Shares to be voted, Dawn M. Becker and Daniel Guglielmone will vote your Shares in accordance with the recommendations of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes submitted by telephone or through the Internet must be received by 11:59 p.m., eastern daylight time, on May 2, 2017 in order to be counted for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the Notice or proxy card for instructions on how to access the telephone and Internet voting systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to change your vote, you may generally revoke your original vote by submitting a subsequent proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will only be counted as present for determining whether we can hold the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not vote your Shares, your Shares will not be counted and we may not be able to hold the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote by proxy using one of the methods described above even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting in person so that we will know as soon as possible whether enough votes will be present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For those of you holding your Shares indirectly through a broker or other nominee, you should receive all proxy materials from them and you must either direct them as to how to vote your Shares, or obtain from them a proxy to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to the notice of internet availability of proxy materials or the voter instruction card used by your broker or other nominee for specific instructions on methods of voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you fail to give your broker or other nominee specific instructions on how to vote your Shares with respect to Proposals 1, 3 and 4, your vote will NOT be counted for those matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important for every shareholders vote to be counted on these matters so we encourage you to provide your broker or other nominee with voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you fail to give your broker or other nominee specific instructions on how to vote your Shares on Proposal 2, your broker or other nominee will generally be able to vote on Proposal 2 as he, she or it determines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, if you own your Shares directly and would like to receive proxy materials by email, you may register to do so at www.astfinancial.com in which case you will receive an email containing links to our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own Shares through a broker or other nominee and want to receive proxy materials via email, you must contact your broker or other nominee for instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive your proxy materials by email delivery will remain in effect for all future annual meetings until you revoke it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders can access this Proxy Statement, our Annual Report and our other filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on the Investors page of our website at www.federalrealty.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our Annual Report, including the financial statements and financial statement schedules (Form 10-K) is being provided to shareholders along with this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Form 10-K includes certain exhibits, which we will provide to you only upon request addressed to Investor Relations at 1626 East Jefferson Street, Rockville, Maryland 20852.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The request must be accompanied by payment of a fee to cover our reasonable expenses for copying and mailing the Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you elected to receive our shareholder materials via the Internet or email, you may request paper copies, without charge, by written request addressed to the address set forth above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SECs rules permit us to deliver a single Notice or single set of Annual Meeting materials to one address shared by two or more of our shareholders unless we have received contrary instructions from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure, referred to as householding, reduces the volume of duplicate information shareholders receive and can result in significant savings on mailing and printing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To take advantage of this opportunity, only one Notice, Proxy Statement and Annual Report is being delivered to multiple shareholders who share a single address, unless any shareholder residing at that address gave contrary instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any shareholder sharing an address with another shareholder wants to receive a separate copy of this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report or wishes to receive a separate proxy statement and annual report in the future, or receives multiple copies of the proxy statement and Annual Report and wishes to receive a single copy, the shareholder should provide such instructions by calling our Investor Relations Department at (800) 937-5449, by writing to Investor Relations at 1626 East Jefferson Street, Rockville, Maryland 20852, or by sending an e-mail to Investor Relations at IR@federalrealty.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Questions regarding the Notice, voting or email delivery should be directed to our Investor Relations Department at (800) 937-5449 or by email at IR@federalrealty.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRUSTEES AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1ELECTION OF TRUSTEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Trustees currently has eight Trustees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the February 2017 Board meeting, Ms. Kristin Gamble advised the Board that she would not stand for re-election, having served on the Board for more than 20 years and nearing the Boards retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gamble will continue to serve as Trustee through the May 2, 2017 Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of the Annual Meeting, the Board will have seven Trustee positions and has nominated the remaining seven Board member to stand for election at the Annual Meeting to fill those positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All trustees elected will hold office until the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and until their successors have been duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, after discussion with one of our shareholders, the Board modified our Bylaws to provide that in uncontested elections such as this one, a nominee had to receive a majority of votes cast in order to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, a nominee had only to receive a plurality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR each of the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following paragraphs provide biographies of each of our nominees that include information regarding the persons service as a trustee, business experience, service on other boards and areas of skill and expertise that were considered by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board in deciding that such individual should serve on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jon E. Bortz, age 60, has served on our Board since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bortz is currently the President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of Pebblebrook Hotel Trust, a REIT that acquires and invests in upper upscale hotels in large US cities (from 2009 to the present).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Mr. Bortz was Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of LaSalle Hotel Properties for more than eight years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bortz brings to the Board public company, REIT and real estate experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His experience as chief executive officer of LaSalle Hotel Properties and Pebblebrook Hotel Trust provide a valuable perspective for running a public real estate company while his real estate experience at Jones Lang LaSalle provides fundamental real estate experience critical to our core business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David W. Faeder, age 60, has served on our Board since 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2003, Mr. Faeder has been a Managing Partner of Fountain Square Properties, a diversified real estate company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over a 10-year period prior to that.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Fader held various positions at Sunrise Senior Living, Inc., a provider of senior living services in the United States, United Kingdom and Canada, including Vice Chairman, President and Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Faeder currently serves as a Director of Arlington Asset Investment Corp., a company that acquires and holds mortgage-related and other assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Faeder is a valuable member of the Board because of his public company and accounting experience, having previously served as the president and chief financial officer of Sunrise Senior Living, and his real estate investment experience from his time as a private real estate investor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elizabeth Holland, age 51, has served on the Board since February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Holland is the Chief Executive Officer of Abbell Credit Corporation and Abbell Associates, LLC, a seventy-year-old private real estate acquisition, development and management company with a portfolio of shopping center, office, and enclosed mall properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She has held those roles since 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Ms. Holland was a practicing attorney and a fixed income portfolio manager.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Holland is active in the International Council of Shopping Centers and serves as its Chairman of the Board of Trustees until May 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board views Ms. Hollands retail real estate expertise and experience as Chairman of ICSC as valuable and complementary skill sets to have on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gail P. Steinel, age 60, has served on the Board since 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2007, Ms. Steinel has been the owner of Executive Advisors, a company that provides consulting services and leadership seminars.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Steinels previous experiences were as Executive Vice President with BearingPoint, Inc., a management and technology consulting firm with responsibility for overseeing the global commercial services business unit and a global managing partner of Arthur Andersens business consulting practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Steinel is currently a director of MTS Systems Corporation, a provider of mechanical test systems, material testing, fatigue testing and tensile testing equipment as well as motion simulation systems and calibration services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Steinel has over 25 years of auditing and consulting experience that provides the Board with a helpful perspective on managing risk and systems operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Warren M. Thompson, age 57, has served on the Board since 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson is the President and Chairman of Thompson Hospitality Corporation, a food service company that owns and operates restaurants and contract food services, since founding the company in October 1992.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompsons experience running restaurants owned by Thompson Hospitality provides the Board and management with a unique perspective that is shared by a large percentage of the Trusts retail tenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joseph S. Vassalluzzo, age 69, has served on the Board since 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Vassalluzzo has served as our Non-Executive Chairman of the Board of Trustees since February 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1997 through 2005, Ms. Vassalluzzo held various positions, including Vice Chairman, with Staples, Inc., a retailer specializing in home, office, and computer products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Vassalluzzo currently serves as the Non-Executive Chairman of the Board of Office Depot, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Vassalluzzos extensive background in retail and real estate as a result of having served as an executive with Staples, including his responsibility for expanding Staples real estate presence, as well as his service on the boards of a number of retailers provides the board and management with retail and retail real estate expertise that is essential to our core business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood currently serves as our President and Chief Executive Officer, positions he has held since 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood joined the Trust in 1998 and also held the positions of Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Mr. Wood is a director of Quality Care Properties, Inc., a real estate company focused on post- acute/skilled nursing and memory care/assisted living properties, and has previously served as a director of Post Properties, Inc., Chairman of the Board of the National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts and a member of the Board of Governors of the International Council of Shopping Centers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Woods tenure with the Trust and his responsibilities as chief executive officer provides the Board with familiarity and details on all aspects of the operations of the Trust.

sentences.text: INDEPENDENCE OF TRUSTEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews on an ongoing basis all relationships between us and each Trustee to determine whether each Trustee is independent or otherwise has any relationship to the Trust that could adversely affect the Trustees ability to exercise independent judgment and to confirm compliance with our Bylaws which provide that no more than one of our Trustees can fail to qualify as independent under the requirements of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the SEC, our Corporate Governance Guidelines and other applicable rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines include a standard that a Trustees position as a director of a company with which we do business does not constitute a material relationship so long as payments made by that company do not account for more than five percent (5%) of our gross revenues or more than ten percent (10%) of the gross revenues of that company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, on recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, considered all relevant facts and circumstances and determined that all Trustees other than Mr. Wood, our Chief Executive Officer, are independent under the standards of the NYSE, the SEC, our Corporate Governance Guidelines and applicable law for Board and Committee Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making that determination, the Board took into account those relationships between us and our Trustees described in the Certain Relationships and Related Transactions section below and, with respect to Mr. Bortz, periodic use of Pebblebrook hotels for accommodations for conferences and business trips for various employees and, with respect to Mr. Vassalluzzo, five leases between Office Depot, Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary, Office Max and the Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IDENTIFYING INDIVIDUALS TO STAND FOR ELECTION AS TRUSTEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for identifying individuals to stand for election as Trustees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers whether the current trustees have all of the requisite skills and perspectives necessary to effectively carry out the Boards oversight function going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee determines that any changes are needed to the size or composition of the Board, the Committee solicits recommendations on new members from other Board members and if no appropriate candidates are identified, the Committee will consider retaining a search firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations provided by shareholders will also be considered and will be evaluated on the same basis as all other Board candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering any individual to stand for election as a trustee, the Committee takes into account the overall mix of knowledge, experience, skills and expertise needed on the Board, the performance of incumbent trustees, and diversity characteristics such as geography, gender and ethnicity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All candidates for election to the Board should, at a minimum, possess public company, real estate, retail and/or other financial experience and have a history of honesty, integrity and fair dealing with third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a candidate is identified who has not previously served on the Board, the candidate meets with other Board members as well as our senior management and the Committee undertakes whatever investigative and due diligence activities it deems necessary to verify the candidates credentials, to determine whether the candidate would be a positive contributor to the operations of the Board and a good representative of our shareholders and to confirm that the candidate satisfies all of the independence requirements imposed by the NYSE, the SEC, our Corporate Governance Guidelines and other applicable rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may propose a candidate to be nominated for election to the Board by following the procedures outlined in Article II, Section 13 of our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders wanting to present a candidate for consideration as a Trustee for election at the Trusts 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders must provide the Committee with the name of the shareholder proposing the candidate as well as contact information for that shareholder, the name of the individual proposed for election, a resume or similar summary that includes the individuals qualifications and such other factual information that would be necessary or helpful for the Committee to evaluate the individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information should be sent to the Committee, in care of the Trusts Secretary, by no later than November 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our Bylaws may be obtained by sending a written request to Investor Relations at 1626 East Jefferson Street, Rockville, MD 20852.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board has delegated to the Audit Committee responsibility for overseeing our risks and exposures on an ongoing basis, the entire Board regularly receives updates from management on the continued viability of our business plan, market conditions, capital position, and our business results and specifically reviews potential risks from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews that information together with our quarterly and annual financial statements and operating results and short and long-term business prospects to assess the risks that we may encounter and to establish appropriate direction to avoid or minimize the potential impact of the identified risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the details that are discussed as part of the Boards review of potential risks facing us include, without limitation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the impact of market conditions on our business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) operational risks such as the ability of our tenants to be successful and the ability to grow the company through increasing rents and redeveloping our properties;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) liquidity and credit risks, including our ability to access capital to run and grow our business and our overall cost of capital and the impact on our profitability;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) investment risks from acquisitions and our development and redevelopment projects;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) regulatory risks that may impact our profitability such as environmental laws and regulations, the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 and various other federal, state and local laws;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) REIT risks such as our failure to qualify as a REIT for federal income tax purposes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) cybersecurity risks; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) general risks inherent in the real estate industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following Report of the Audit Committee does not constitute soliciting material and should not be deemed filed or incorporated by reference into any other Trust filing under the Securities Act of 1933 or the Exchange Act, except to the extent the Trust specifically incorporates this Report by reference therein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our role as the Audit Committee is to oversee the financial reporting process on behalf of the Board, including oversight of the Trusts management, internal auditor and independent registered public accounting firm in their performance of the following functions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for the financial reporting process, including the system of internal controls, for the preparation of consolidated financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States (GAAP) and for managements report on internal control over financial reporting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant Thornton, LLP (GT), the Trusts independent registered public accounting firm, is responsible for auditing the consolidated financial statements and expressing an opinion on the financial statements and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets at least quarterly and at such other times as it deems necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee held four meetings in 2016 and met three times with GT in executive session without management being present and met with PwC three times including once without management being present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed with management and GT, individually and collectively, all annual and quarterly financial statements and operating results prior to their issuance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has advised the Audit Committee that all financial statements were prepared in accordance with GAAP;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with GT matters required to be discussed pursuant to applicable audit standards, including the reasonableness of judgments and the clarity and completeness of financial disclosures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed and discussed with GT and PwC, individually and collectively, the ongoing assessment and testing of the Trusts systems of internal controls and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its 2016 audit of our financial statements, GT independently reviewed our system of internal controls and procedures and issued an unqualified report thereon;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with GT matters relating to GTs independence from the Trust and received written confirmation from GT that GT is not aware of any relationships, that in their professional judgment may impair their independence; and;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitored the non-audit services provided by GT to ensure that performance of such services will not adversely impact GTs independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That included approval of the non-audit services for 2017 described in the Ratification of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm section below and an audit for one of our consolidated properties with partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Audit Committees reviews and discussions with GT, PwC and management, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Trustees that the Board approve the inclusion of our audited financial statements in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gail P. Steinel, Chairperson Jon E. Bortz David W. Faeder Warren M. Thompson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2RATIFICATION OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is asking shareholders to ratify its selection of GT as our independent registered public accounting firm fo the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our organizational documents do not require ratification of the selection of our independen registered public accounting firm; however, we believe that it is a matter of good corporate practice to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the selection of GT is not ratified, the Audit Committee may reconsider whether to retain GT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection of GT is ratified, the Audit Committee may change the appointment of GT at any time if it determines such a change would be in the best interests of the Trust and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR this proposal

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GT is familiar with our affairs and financial procedures having served as our independent accountant since June 2002 and is registered with the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation, Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) describes the material components of, and the material factors and considerations behind, the compensation and benefits paid to our named executive officers for 2016 who are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Donald C. Wood, President and Chief Executive Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Daniel Guglielmone, Executive Vice PresidentChief Financial Officer and Treasurer (effective August 15, 2016);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dawn M. Becker, Executive Vice PresidentGeneral Counsel and Secretary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James M. Taylor, Jr., former Executive Vice PresidentChief Financial Officer and Treasurer (January 1May 19, 20
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be asked in Proposal 3 of this proxy statement to provide a non-binding, advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers as described in the following sections of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please keep that in mind as you review the CD&A, summary compensation table, the supplemental tables and narrative disclosures that follow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual shareholder meeting, approximately 94% of the votes cast at the meeting supported our advisory vote on compensation for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this strong level of support reflected a high degree of shareholder confidence in our executive compensation programs, and as a result, no changes were made to the compensation programs for our named executive officers in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Performance Highlights:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial:        Generated more than $800 million of gross revenuesa record level that is 7.7% more than 2015 gross revenues      Grew net income available for common shareholders by $40 million to a record $249 million      Record level of FFO  of $406 million, resulting in FFO per share of $5.65an increase of 6.2% over 2015 (excluding 2015 impact of debt prepayment charge)      Raised $566 million of capital, including the issuance of 30-year unsecured notes at an effective interest rate of 3.75%, the lowest in the REIT sector      Increased our annual dividend for the 49  consecutive year   Operational:        Increased cash basis rents by 13% on 346 new and renewal leases for space where there was a prior tenant; will generate more than $6 million of additional rent per year      Opened Splunk as the tenant in our 234,500 square foot office building at Santana Row   Strategic:        Acquired our partners 70% interest in a six property portfolio      Hired Daniel Guglielmone as our Chief Financial Officer   Environmental/ Social/ Governance:        Received a 4 Green Star rating from Global Real Estate Sustainability Benchmark and ranked 1  in North America for Health and Wellness      Received Seal of Approval Awards from the Alliance for Workplace Excellence for Overall Excellence (9  consecutive year), Health and Wellness (9  consecutive year) and EcoLeadership (6  consecutive year)      Installed 9 new solar rooftop systems to bring our total count to 19.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These 19 solar installations are projected to generate on an annualized basis 12,265 MWH of electricity, offsetting 18.6 million pounds of CO2   1 th st th th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FFO (Funds From Operations) is a supplemental non-GAAP financial measure of real estate companies operating performances.

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe in pay for performance compensation programs in which a majority of our executives compensation is tied to company success in meeting predetermined performance objectives and creating long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This strategy motivates our executives to achieve our annual and longer-term strategic and financial goals, aligns our executives with our shareholders and recognizes the executives contributions in delivering strong corporate performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this by providing a strong link between an executives total earnings opportunity and both our short-term and long-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set levels of compensation for each executive that are competitive with the market in order to ensure that we can attract and retain high-caliber executives in the marketplace in which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key principles guiding our compensation programs and decisions are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Compensation Levels:        Total compensation levels competitive with the marketplace      Aggregate compensation levels reasonable in the context of our overall cost structure and that support our business strategy   Significant At Risk Compensation:        Relatively small portion of compensation is guaranteed      Significant portion of compensation varies based on our short-term and long-term performance   Variability based on Individual Performance:          Amount earned by an executive varies based on the individuals performance and overall contribution and value to the business   Significant Equity Ownership:        Significant portion of compensation is paid in the form of equity        Named executive officers required to maintain a significant equity ownership position      Prohibition against hedging and pledging our Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Methodology:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of the Board is responsible for approving all compensation for our named executive officers and periodically reviews all elements of compensation to ensure that we remain competitive in the market and that overall compensation, including the means by which payment is made, is aligned with our business objectives, our performance and the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee conducts an annual review of our CEOs performance and takes those results into consideration when setting his compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO makes recommendations for the compensation for our other named executive officers based on his evaluation of their performance and the Compensation Committee has the discretion to accept, reject or modify the CEOs recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total potential compensation for our named executive officers is established based on the scope of his or her individual responsibilities and contributions to our performance taking into account competitive market compensation paid for similar positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive market compensation for our named executive officers is generally determined by the Compensation Committee members applying their individual understanding, experiences and judgments in the national marketplace of senior level real estate positions and related industry pay in both public and private concerns that may compete for our executives, considering the relative importance of various positions at the Trust given our business plan and organization compared with the business plans of our major competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to that judgment and experience, the Compensation Committee also consulted the National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts 2015 and 2016 Compensation Surveys (NAREIT Surveys) to confirm its assessment of appropriate market compensation for our named executive officers, both the information reported for each position by the 141 real estate investment trusts (REITs) that participated in the survey as well as by the approximately 31 retail focused REITs that participated in the survey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NAREIT Surveys are limited in their applicability as they do not include private real estate company data nor do they include all REITs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, not all REITS that participated in the surveys provided information for each of the named executive officer positions and it is not possible to determine from the NAREIT Surveys which of the participating REITs provided information for which executive officer position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the Compensation Committee determines an appropriate level of aggregate compensation for our named executive officers, an individual compensation package is created using a combination of base salary, annual bonus and long- term equity incentives, all in accordance with the compensation philosophy and objectives described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of Total Compensation and 2016 Performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are used to compensate the executive for services rendered during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are set at the beginning of each year and are intended to be competitive with the market and commensurate with the executives level of responsibility, experience and sustained individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries provide retention value and also align the executive with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, we believe that executive base salaries should account for a relatively modest portion of each individuals total compensation package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we start our process with determining an appropriate level of total compensation, we do not target base salaries to any specific level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did, however, use information in the NAREIT Surveys as a guide to confirm that the base salaries for our named executive officers are within market parameters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Performance Bonus:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual performance bonuses for each of our named executive officers are determined each year in accordance with our Annual Bonus Plan that covers approximately 96% of our employees and compensates individuals for performance during a calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment under the Annual Bonus Plan is dependent on:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the Trusts achieving an annual level of FFO per share that is consistent with our business objectives for that year; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the individuals achieving his or her annual performance objectives as subjectively evaluated by the Board with respect to our CEO and by our CEO with respect to each of our other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Annual Bonus Plan, the Compensation Committee sets annually a potential bonus payout for each of our named executive officers for achieving various levels of FFO per share for that calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also has the ability to decrease the final annual bonus payout of any of our executive officers based on his or her performance for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our named executive officers (as well as 84 other employees) has the option to receive up to 25% of the annual bonus in the form of Shares that vest equally over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount an individual elects to receive in Shares is paid out at 120% of that amount in consideration of the extended vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash portion of the 2016 annual bonuses paid to our executive officers is reflected in the Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation column in the Summary Compensation Table in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Share portion of these annual bonuses will be included in the Stock Awards column in the Summary Compensation Table and the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table in next years proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of each year, the Compensation Committee establishes the FFO per share that has to be achieved for our named executive officers and other employees to earn an annual performance bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The FFO per share levels established by the Compensation Committee are intended to reflect acceptable to exceptional performance in light of our business objectives for that year and are established by the Compensation Committee after a thorough review and discussion of our budget and investor expectations for that year and after considering recommendations of our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FFO is widely accepted in the REIT industry as an appropriate measurement of operating performance on an annual basis and as a result, we believe FFO per share is an appropriate metric to use for determining annual financial success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart shows the 2016 FFO per share levels set by the Compensation Committee, the payout potential as a percentage of each executives bonus target for achieving each level of FFO per share and the actual FFO per share achieved in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on achieving FFO per share for 2016 of $5.65, the potential annual bonus payout for each of our named executive officers is 112.5% of target bonus levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Appendix A to this proxy statement for additional information about FFO and a reconciliation of FFO to net income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Based Long-Term Equity Incentives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that outstanding long-term performance is achieved through an ownership culture that encourages a focus on long- term performance by our executive officers through the use of equity-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentive awards are made annually under our Long-Term Incentive Award Program (LTIAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program was structured to align the most significant portion of compensation for our senior management team with the creation of long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recipients of awards under this program realize value over a minimum 6-year time horizon that includes a 3-year performance period, an award date, plus by a minimum of a 3-year time based vesting period for Shares and a 5-year vesting period for options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart shows the time horizon for awards made for the 3-year performance period ending December 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the combination of this extended period with the requirements described below for our named executive officers to continually hold a meaningful equity position in the company creates a strong long-term alignment of interests between those individuals and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance metrics under this program are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) total shareholder return relative to the Bloomberg REIT Shopping Center Index (BBRESHOP) which accounts for 50% of the total award;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) absolute total shareholder return which accounts for 25% of the total award; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) return on invested capital which accounts for 25% of the total award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the LTIAP, total shareholde return takes into account both Share price appreciation and dividends assuming all dividends are reinvested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that these metrics are appropriate metrics to use for rewarding long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The relative shareholder return metric reflects how well we have performed for our shareholders as compared to other companies facing the same general market dynamics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the BBRESHOP was the best index to use because the BBRESHOP is an industry index primarily made up of companies that own and operate strip shopping centers whose businesses are most closely aligned with ours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absolute shareholder return measures whether we have actually created any value for our shareholders during the applicable 3-year performance period and return on invested capital reflects how effectively we have allocated our shareholders capital during that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance metrics support the objectives of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The levels of performance required to be achieved for each metric for Mr. Wood and Ms. Becker to earn an LTIAP award, the amount to be earned as a percentage of each executives LTIAP target and the performance actually achieved on each metric for the three year period from January 1, 2014 through December 31, 2016 are set forth in the chart below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The same metrics and performance levels are also applicable to Mr. Guglielmone; however, his payout levels on achieving the various levels of results are 67%/100%/133% of his target for each metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the discretion to increase or decrease the award for each executive by up to 20% to in order to account for personal performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTIAP awards are made in the form of restricted Shares that vest in equal installments over a three-year period; however, each individual can elect to take up to 50% of his or her award in the form of options which vest equally over five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Compensation Committee believes that paying these awards in restricted Shares provides the most retention value for employees, it has agreed to permit individuals to elect to take up to 50% of the award in options in order to give the individual employee some ability to structure his or her own equity compensation in a way that best matches the individuals needs and provides the most value to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has concluded that individual employees place value in having the ability to match the form of their equity compensation to their individual financial objectives and that this value to employees outweighs any diminution in the retention value of LTIAP awards by permitting up to 50% to be paid in options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends are paid on all Shares issued under the LTIAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of Shares actually awarded to each individual under the LTIAP is determined by dividing the amount of the award by the closing price of our Shares on the NYSE on the date the awards are made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no amount included for 2016 in the Summary Compensation Table or Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table in this proxy statement for LTIAP awards earned for the 2014- 2016 performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTIAP awards reflected for 2016 in the Summary Compensation Table and the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table for our named executive officers in this proxy statement relate to awards made in February 2016 for the 3-year performance period ending December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking into account market conditions as well as company and individual performance, the Compensation Committee made the following decisions in 2016 with respect to our named executive officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Donald C. Wood, Chief Executive Officer:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary: The Compensation Committee increased Mr. Woods 2016 base salary from $850,000 to $950,000 at its meeting on February 3, 2016, slightly less than a 12% increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This was the first time Mr. Woods base pay had been increased since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believed this was an appropriate increase to reflect current market rates for someone with Mr. Woods experience and high level of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Performance Bonus: At its meeting on February 8, 2017, the Committee elected to award Mr. Wood a bonus at 100% of his target instead of the full 112.5% of target he would have been entitled to receive based on company performance, a decrease of approximately $178,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee noted that underperformance at
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: one of the Trusts large mixed use developments (Pike & Rose) warranted such a reduction for Mr. Wood, as well as the other named executive officers.

sentences.text: Mr. Wood elected to take 25% of his annual performance bonus in the form of restricted shares and the remainder in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTIAP: Based on performance levels achieved for this program, the award potential for Mr. Wood was 146.3% of target or approximately $7.3 million; however, for the same reasons noted above relating to the underperformance at one of the Trusts large mixed use developments (Pike & Rose), the Compensation Committee, at its meeting on February 8, 2017, elected to reduce Mr. Woods award to $6.5 million (approximately 11% decrease) to account for lower than initially forecasted returns on that project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood elected to take 100% of his award in the form of restricted shares.

sentences.text: Other: Mr. Wood does not receive any benefits or other perquisites that are not widely available to other employees of the company other than a health care arrangement outlined in a Health Coverage Continuation Agreement.

sentences.text: Under that agreement, we have agreed to provide to Mr. Wood, his spouse and his dependents continuation of health coverage after Mr. Woods termination upon death, disability, retirement, change in control or otherwise (other than a termination with cause or resignation).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coverage will continue as to Mr. Wood and his spouse until their death, or with respect to his spouse until divorce, if earlier, and coverage continues for three of Mr. Woods children until each reaches age twenty-five and as to one of the children, until her death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to provide coverage of at least the same level as provided to Mr. Wood and his family at the time of his termination and such coverage will be secondary to certain other coverages that may be available to Mr. Wood and his family.

sentences.text: This agreement has been in place and remained unchanged since 2008.

sentences.text: Other Compensation Considerations:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At-Risk Compensation: One of our key compensation principles is that the compensation of our named executive officers should include a significant portion that is at risk and variable depending on both our short-term financial performance and long-term creation of shareholder value with the largest portion of that at risk compensation designed to incentivize the creation of sustainable, long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The at risk portion of 2016 compensation for our named executive officers is comprised of amounts paid under our Annual Bonus Plan and performance based, long-term equity awards under our LTIAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below shows that the at risk portions of compensation represent a significant percentage of the total compensation for each of our named executive officersapproximately 89% for Mr. Wood and 73% for each of Mr. Guglielmone and Ms. Becker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Ownership: Each of our named executive officers is required to maintain a level of ownership of equity in the company equal to a multiple of the sum of his or her base salary and annual bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The required multiples for our named executive officers are 3 times for Mr. Wood and 2.5 times for each of Mr. Guglielmone and Ms. Becker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of Mr. Wood and Ms. Becker were in compliance with the equity ownership requirement as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Guglielmone joined the Trust in August 2016 and will have 5 years to meet the equity ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Assessment: As described in the Risk Management Oversight section, we have concluded that our compensation programs do not encourage excessive or unnecessary risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not currently have any clawback or other compensation recovery policy with respect to compensation that may have been paid on the basis of incorrect financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the SECs pending clawback rule, the Board elected to wait until the final rulemaking was in place before adopting a clawback policy so that our the policy would be in full compliance with SEC requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Timing of Equity Grants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards to our employees under our Annual Bonus Plan and LTIAP described above are made at the Compensation Committees meeting that occurs in February of each calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether these awards are made before or after we release financial results for the prior fiscal year depends solely on when the Compensation Committee meets in relation to the meetings of the Board and the Audit Committee, the dates for all of which are set during the preceding year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no policy that times the granting of equity awards relative to the release of material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards to new hires are generally made on the first day on which the employee starts work and equity awards to employees who are promoted generally are made on the day on which the promotion has been fully approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our options are awarded at the closing price of our Shares on the NYSE on the date the award is made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has never re-priced options, granted options with an exercise price that is less than the closing price on the NYSE on the date of the grant or granted options which are priced on a date other than the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards for Vice Presidents and above for the 3-year performance period ending on December 31, 2016 were made at the Compensation Committees meeting on February 7, 2017 based on the closing price of our Shares on the NYSE on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination and Change-in-Control Arrangements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have agreements in place with each of our named executive officers providing for various payments and benefits to be made to them if there is a change in control or their employment with us is terminated for certain reasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The circumstances in which payments may be made and the potential amounts of those payments are described in more detail in the Potential Payments on Termination of Employment and Change-in-Control section below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the payments provided for in these agreements are reasonable and appropriate as part of the total compensation packages available for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation in Excess of $1.0 Million:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally prohibits any publicly held corporation from taking a federal income tax deduction for compensation in excess of $1 million in any taxable year to an executive officer who is named in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exceptions are made for qualified performance-based compensation, among other things.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In structuring our compensation programs, the Compensation Committee considers this Section 162(m) exception; however, the Compensation Committee does not believe that it is necessarily in our best interests and the best interests of our shareholders for all compensation to meet the requirements of Section 162(m) for deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Compensation Committee has determined that it is appropriate at times to make compensation awards that are non-deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, because of ambiguities and uncertainties under Section 162(m), we cannot give any assurance that compensation that we intend to satisfy the requirements for deductibility under Section 162(m) will in fact be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a non-qualified deferred compensation plan that is open to participation by 34 members of our management team, including our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each participant can elect to defer up to 100% of his or her base salary and cash payment under our Annual Bonus Plan with deferral elections made in December of each year for amounts to be earned in the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A number of widely available investment options are made available to each plan participant who then decides how to allocate amounts deferred among those investment options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount earned by plan participants on their deferrals is calculated by our third party plan administrator as if the amounts deferred had actually been invested in the investment options selected by each participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not make any contributions to the deferred compensation plan for any individual nor do we guaranty any rate of return on amounts deferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred into the plan, including amounts earned on the deferrals, are generally payable to the participant shortly after he or she retires or is otherwise no longer employed by us; however, there are a few other alternatives where amounts may be paid to a participant sooner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an unsecured contractual obligation to each participant in the plan to pay him or her the actual amount he or she deferred into the plan together with a return calculated as if the deferred amounts had been invested in the investment options selected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We try to invest amounts deferred by participants into the same investment options in the same proportions as selected by the participant so that sufficient amounts will be available to pay each participant when required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts deferred by Ms. Becker and Mr. Wood into the plan in 2016, the earnings on plan investments in 2016 and aggregate withdrawals and distributions made in 2016 are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POTENTIAL PAYMENTS ON TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT AND CHANGE-IN-CONTROL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into agreements with each of our named executive officers that require us to make certain payments and provide certain benefits to them in the event of a termination of employment or change in control of the Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of the reason for a named executive officers termination of employment, he or she will be entitled to receive upon termination all accrued but unused vacation pay and a distribution of any amounts in our non-qualified deferred compensation plan as described in the 2016 Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation section above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No named executive officer is entitled to receive an award under the Annual Bonus Plan or the LTIAP for the year in which the termination occurs or for the year prior to the year of termination unless he or she is still employed when those awards are made in February of the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements with each of our named executive officers contain provisions restricting the executive from engaging in competing behavior and soliciting and/or hiring our employees for a period of time after termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments that will be made to a named executive officer vary depending on the reason for termination, may be conditioned on the signing of a release in favor of the Trust, and are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Payments on Voluntary Termination: On any voluntary termination of employment, the named executive officers receive no additional compensation and all unvested options and Shares are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive officer has one year after terminating employment to exercise all vested options (subject to the 10-year term of those options).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Mr. Wood, all rights to receive extended health insurance coverage under the Health Coverage Continuation Agreement are terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Payments on Death and Disability: Upon death, the estates of our named executive officers receive the amount of his or her then current salary through the month in which death occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of disability, our named executive officers are entitled to receive payments for one year equal to the difference between his or her then current salary and the amount of any payments received under any disability policy we maintained for his or her benefit and to receive health benefits for one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those payments are subject to gross-up for taxes on any non-tax exempt payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On death or disability, there is accelerated vesting of all Shares issued under the Annual Bonus Plan and all Shares and options issued under the LTIAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This accelerated vesting is the same for all employees on a non-discriminatory basis who hold any Shares or options issued under the Annual Bonus Plan or the LTIAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retention/Non-Solicitation Award to Ms. Becker in February 2011 does not provide for accelerated vesting in the event of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive officer or his or her beneficiary has two years after the executives death or disability to exercise all vested options (subject to the 10-year term of those options), including options that vested as a result of the death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Wood will receive the benefits described in his Health Coverage Continuation Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Payment on Termination for Cause: Upon termination for cause resulting from a failure to substantially perform his or her job responsibilities, each of our named executive officers is entitled to receive one month of base salary for every year he or she has been employed by us over 5 years up to a maximum of 6 months of base salary and to receive health benefits for that same time period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers are not entitled to receive any compensation on a termination with cause for any reason other than failure to perform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a termination for cause, all unvested options and Shares are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the right to exercise any previously vested options issued under the LTIAP immediately terminates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Mr. Wood, all rights to receive extended health insurance coverage under the Health Coverage Continuation Agreement are terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Termination without Cause: Upon a termination without cause, each of our named executive officers is entitled to receive the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum cash payment equal to a multiple of the highest base salary and the highest annual bonus earned by the named executive officer in the prior three year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Ms. Becker and Mr. Guglielmone, the multiple is 1 time and for Mr. Wood, the multiple is 1.5 times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of health and welfare benefits for a period of 9 months for Ms. Becker and Mr. Wood and 12 months for Mr. Guglielmone
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outplacement and administrative assistance for a period of 6 months
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Guglielmone is only entitled to the foregoing payments if the termination without cause occurs during the first three years of Mr. Guglielmones employment with the Trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the vesting of all unvested Shares issued under the Annual Bonus Plan and all unvested Shares and options issued under the LTIAP is accelerated for each of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This accelerated vesting is the same for all employees on a non-discriminatory basis who hold any Shares or options issued under the Annual Bonus Plan or the LTIAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retention/Non-Solicitation Award to Ms. Becker in February 2011 does not provide for accelerated vesting in the event of a termination without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive officer has one year after the executives termination to exercise all vested options (subject to the 10-year term of those options), including options that vested as a result of the termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Wood will receive the benefits described in his Health Coverage Continuation Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Change of Control: Upon a change of control, each named executive officer is entitled to receive the following payments so long as he or she
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) is terminated from employment by the Trust other than for cause or leaves for good reason within two years after the change of control or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) as to Mr. Wood and Ms. Becker only, he or she voluntarily leaves employment within the thirty day window following the 1-year anniversary of the change of control:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum cash payment equal to a multiple of the highest base salary and highest annual bonus earned by the named executive officer in the prior three year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Ms. Becker and Mr. Guglielmone the multiple is 2 times and for Mr. Wood, the multiple is 3 times
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of health and welfare benefits for a period of 2 years for Ms. Becker and Mr. Guglielmone and 3 years for Mr. Wood
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued use of any company owned automobile for 3 years for Mr. Wood
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outplacement and administrative assistance for a period of 9 months for Ms. Becker and Mr. Guglielmone and 12 months for Mr. Wood
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An amount equal to the excise tax charged to Mr. Wood or Ms. Becker as a result of receiving any change of control payments plus an additional gross-up amount sufficient to pay the taxes to be paid by Mr. Wood or Ms. Becker on the excise tax payment received
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if the named executive officer is terminated within one year after the change of control, the vesting of all unvested Shares issued under the Annual Bonus Plan and all unvested Shares and options issued under the LTIAP is accelerated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This accelerated vesting is the same for all employees on a non-discriminatory basis who hold any Shares or options issued under the Annual Bonus Plan or the LTIAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each named executive officer has one year after the executives termination to exercise all vested options (subject to the 10-year term of those options), including options that vested as a result of the termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in the event of a change of control, the unvested Shares issued under the Retention/Non-Solicitation Award to Ms. Becker in February 2011 will vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood will also receive the benefits described in his Health Coverage Continuation Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our 2001 and 2010 Plans, a change of control is deemed to have occurred when a person acquires a 20% interest in us, or our current Trustees, or those subsequently approved by our current Trustees, constitute less than two-thirds of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
